name: Jersey
description: Jersey, a self-governing Crown Dependency located off the coast of Normandy, France, is a picturesque island renowned for its stunning coastline, dramatic granite cliffs, lush green pastures, and rich history.  It boasts a unique blend of British and French influences, reflected in its architecture, cuisine, and culture.  The island’s relatively small size belies its diverse landscape, offering a wealth of outdoor activities and a tranquil atmosphere.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: The population of Jersey is comprised of a diverse community with a strong sense of local identity.
quickFacts.detail: The majority of residents are of British descent, with a significant French-Jèrriais speaking minority.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Jersey is a relatively small island, making it easily navigable and offering a sense of intimacy.
quickFacts.detail: It’s larger than many other British Channel Islands.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: The Jersey Pound is pegged to the British Pound at a 1:1 ratio.
quickFacts.detail: While the British Pound is widely accepted, the Jersey Pound is used for local transactions.

quickFacts.label: Language
quickFacts.description: English is the official language, but Jèrriais, a Norman dialect, is still spoken by a portion of the population.
quickFacts.detail: Jèrriais is a unique and endangered language.

quickFacts.label: Government
quickFacts.description: Jersey has a unique political status, governed by a Royal Appointment and a States Assembly.
quickFacts.detail: It is not part of the United Kingdom but is under the protection of the British Crown.

climateData.title: Jersey's Temperate Maritime Climate
climateData.description: Jersey enjoys a mild, temperate maritime climate influenced by the Atlantic Ocean. Summers are generally warm and sunny, while winters are cool and damp, with frequent showers.  The Gulf Stream moderates temperatures, preventing extremes.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Spring brings a gradual warming and the return of wildflowers to the island's meadows and coastal paths.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Summer is the warmest and driest time of year, with long sunny days and pleasant temperatures.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Autumn brings cooler temperatures, increased rainfall, and stunning autumn foliage in the island's forests.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Winter is the coolest and wettest time of year, with frequent showers and occasional frost.

naturalWonders.name: The Grells
naturalWonders.description: The Grells are a series of dramatic, jagged granite cliffs along the north-east coast of Jersey. These imposing formations offer breathtaking views of the English Channel and are a testament to the island's geological history.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Formed by ancient volcanic activity and erosion, the Grells are a haven for seabirds and provide a challenging but rewarding hiking experience. The sheer scale and rugged beauty of the cliffs are truly awe-inspiring.

naturalWonders.name: Corblets
naturalWonders.description: Corblets is a unique and picturesque cove on the west coast of Jersey, known for its sheltered beach and dramatic rock formations.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The name 'Corblets' comes from the Cornish word for 'small coves'. The beach is a mix of sand and pebbles, and the surrounding cliffs provide a stunning backdrop. It's a popular spot for swimming, sunbathing, and exploring.

naturalWonders.name: Manoir Farm
naturalWonders.description: Manoir Farm is a quintessential Jersey landscape, showcasing the island's traditional agricultural heritage with its rolling green pastures, stone walls, and charming farm buildings.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The farm is a working dairy farm, producing high-quality Jersey milk and cheese. It’s a beautiful example of rural Jersey life and offers a glimpse into the island’s agricultural past. The surrounding countryside is perfect for walking and cycling.

biodiversityCategory.name: Coastal Ecology
biodiversityCategory.description: Jersey’s coastline is a vital habitat for a diverse range of marine and avian species, shaped by the island’s unique geology and maritime environment.

statistics.details: Jersey is home to significant colonies of seabirds, including gulls, terns, and puffins.
Dolphins and porpoises are occasionally sighted off the coast.

notableSpecies.name: Atlantic Puffin
notableSpecies.significance: A key indicator species for the health of the marine environment.

notableSpecies.name: Grey Seal
notableSpecies.significance: A protected species that breeds on the island’s beaches.

ecosystemData.title: Jersey's Coastal Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Jersey’s coastal ecosystems are characterized by a mosaic of habitats, including rocky shores, sandy beaches, salt marshes, and seagrass beds. These diverse environments support a rich array of plant and animal life.

biodiversityCategories.name: Coastal Vegetation
biodiversityCategories.description: The coastal vegetation includes sea thrift, thrift, and various grasses and herbs adapted to the harsh conditions of the shoreline.

statistics.details: A dominant plant species on the island’s cliffs.

activities.title: Outdoor Activities in Jersey
activities.description: Jersey offers a wide range of outdoor activities for all interests and abilities, from challenging hikes to relaxing beach days.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore Jersey’s stunning coastline and countryside on foot.

activities.name: Grells Coastal Path Hike
activities.description: A challenging hike along the dramatic Grells cliffs, offering spectacular views.

activities.name: Pomme de Terre Trail
activities.description: A scenic trail through the Pomme de Terre valley, offering beautiful views of the surrounding countryside.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy a variety of water sports along Jersey’s beautiful coastline.

activities.name: Kayaking
activities.description: Explore the coastline and discover hidden coves by kayak.

activities.name: Sailing
activities.description: Take advantage of Jersey’s sheltered waters and enjoy a day of sailing.

clothing.winter: Warm layers, waterproof jacket and trousers, hat and gloves
